data.title: Arthur Wilkinson Obituary

data.text:
Arthur Edgar Wilkinson OBITUARY

July 27, 1919 – May 2, 2005

Eddie Wilkinson passed away suddenly on May 2, 2005. Eddie was born in Missouri on July 27, 1919, to Allen and Minnie Belle (Elson) Wilkinson. Following his high school graduation, he joined the Army and served in the 6th Armored Division under General Patton.

Eddie married the love of his life, Naomi Elizabeth McReynolds, on Dec. 25, 1940. They made their home in Napa, where he worked as a chef and clerk at Food City for many years. Eddie was active with many friends in SIRS and enjoyed traveling with his wife, especially to Hawaii.

Eddie is survived by his wife, Naomi Wilkinson of Napa; son, Ron Wilkinson and his wife Judi of Sacramento; granddaughter, Debbie and her husband Alan Holmes of Susanville, granddaughter Nataley and her husband Bill Horstkamp of Medford, Ore., and grandson Todd and his wife Laura of Colfax; six great-grandchildren, Taylor, Janae, Billie, Heide, Brennan and Ryan, and one great-great-grandchild, Kaden Aumann; two nieces, Nancy and her husband John Cash of Benicia and Doris Miller of Palm Desert; and one nephew, Joe and his wife Donene of Sacramento.

Visitation will be held from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. today at Richard Pierce Funeral Service, 1660 Silverado Trail, Napa. Friends and family are invited to attend a service to celebrate Eddie’s life at 2 p.m. Saturday, May 7, at First Christian Church, 2659 First St., Napa. The Rev. Erwin Bollinger will officiate. A private graveside service will follow.

In lieu of flowers, the family requests that donations in Eddie¹s name be made to the Veterans of Foreign Wars.
